intro: Hieracium lakelandicum, commonly known as Lakeland hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and hairy, basal leaves. Native to the British Isles, it thrives in grassy habitats and open woodlands. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 centimeters and produces numerous small, herbaceous stems. It is often found in limestone soils and is considered a characteristic plant of the Lakeland region.
